00040   # Loads the syntax highlighting information.
00041   proc load_syntax {} {
00042     
00043     variable langs
00044     
00045     # Load the tke_dir syntax files
00046     set sfiles [glob -nocomplain -directory [file join $::tke_dir data syntax] *.syntax]
00047     
00048     # Load the tke_home syntax files
00049     set sfiles [concat $sfiles [glob -nocomplain -directory [file join $::tke_home syntax] *.syntax]]
00050     
00051     # Get the syntax information from all of the files in the user's syntax directory.
00052     foreach sfile $sfiles {
00053       if {![catch { open $sfile r } rc]} {
00054         set name [file rootname [file tail $sfile]]
00055         set langs($name) [read $rc]
00056         [ns launcher]::register [msgcat::mc "Syntax:  %s" $name] "syntax::set_language $name"
00057         close $rc
00058       }
00059     }
00060     
00061     # Calculate the filetypes array
00062     create_filetypes
00063     
00064   }
00065   
00066   ######################################################################
00067   # Generates the filetypes list.
00068   proc create_filetypes {} {
00069     
00070     variable langs
00071     variable filetypes
00072     
00073     # Calculate the filetypes array
00074     set filetypes [list]
00075     foreach {name syntax_list} [array get langs] {
00076       array set lang_array $syntax_list
00077       set extensions [list]
00078       foreach pattern $lang_array(filepatterns) {
00079         if {[regexp {^\.\w+$} [set extension [file extension $pattern]]]} {
00080           lappend extensions $extension
00081         }
00082       }
00083       lappend syntax_list extensions $extensions
00084       set langs($name) $syntax_list
00085       if {[llength $extensions] > 0} {
00086         lappend filetypes [list "$name Files" $extensions TEXT]
00087       }
00088     }
00089     
00090     # Sort the filetypes by name
00091     set filetypes [lsort -index 0 $filetypes]
00092     
00093     # Add an "All Files" to the beginning of the filetypes list
00094     set filetypes [list [list "All Files" "*"] {*}$filetypes]
00095     
00096   }

00118       if {![catch { open $tfile r } rc]} {

00120         set themes($name) [list name $name {*}[read $rc]]
00121         [ns launcher]::register [msgcat::mc "Theme:  %s" $name] [list [ns syntax]::set_theme $name]
00122         close $rc
00123       }

00129     # Trace changes to syntax preference values

00152   # Sets the theme to the specified value.  Returns 1 if the theme was
00153   # set; otherwise, returns 0.
00154   proc set_theme {theme_name} {
00155     
00156     variable themes
00157     variable theme
00158     variable lang
00159     variable colorizers
00160     
00161     if {[info exists themes($theme_name)]} {
00162       
00163       # Set the current theme array
00164       array set theme $themes($theme_name)
00165       
00166       # Remove theme values that aren't in the Appearance/Colorize array
00167       foreach name [array names theme] {
00168         if {[info exists colorizers($name)] && \
00169             [lsearch [[ns preferences]::get Appearance/Colorize] $name] == -1} {
00170           set theme($name) ""
00171         }
00172       }
00173       
00174       # Iterate through our tab list and update there
00175       foreach txt [array names lang] {
00176         if {[winfo exists $txt]} {
00177           set_language $lang($txt) $txt
00178         } else {
00179           unset lang($txt)
00180         }
00181       }
00182       
00183     }
00184     
00185     return 0
00186     
00187   }

00200   # Given the specified filename, returns the language name that supports
00201   # it.  If multiple languages respond, use the first match.
00202   proc get_default_language {filename} {
00203     
00204     variable langs
00205     
00206     foreach lang [array names langs] {
00207       array set lang_array $langs($lang)
00208       foreach filepattern $lang_array(filepatterns) {
00209         if {[string match $filepattern $filename]} {
00210           return $lang
00211         }
00212       }
00213     }
00214     
00215     return "None"
00216     
00217   }

00259   # Sets the language of the given text widget to the given language.
00260   proc set_language {language {txt ""}} {
00261     
00262     variable langs
00263     variable theme
00264     variable lang
00265     
00266     # If a text widget wasn't specified, get the current text widget
00267     if {$txt eq ""} {
00268       set txt [[ns gui]::current_txt {}]
00269     }
00270     
00271     # Clear the syntax highlighting for the widget
00272     ctext::clearHighlightClasses   $txt
00273     ctext::setBlockCommentPatterns $txt {}
00274     ctext::setLineCommentPatterns  $txt {}
00275     ctext::setStringPatterns       $txt {}
00276     
00277     # Set the text background color to the current theme
00278     $txt configure -background $theme(background) -foreground $theme(foreground) \
00279       -selectbackground $theme(selectbackground) -selectforeground $theme(selectforeground) \
00280       -insertbackground $theme(cursor) -highlightcolor $theme(highlightcolor) \
00281       -linemapbg $theme(background) -linemapfg $theme(foreground) \
00282       -warnwidth_bg $theme(warnwidthcolor)
00283     
00284     # Set default indent/unindent strings
00285     [ns indent]::set_indent_expressions $txt.t {\{} {\}}
00286     
00287     # Set the snippet set to the current language
00288     [ns snippets]::set_language $language
00289     
00290     # Apply the new syntax highlighting syntax, if one exists for the given language
00291     if {[info exists langs($language)]} {
00292       
00293       if {[catch {
00294         
00295         array set lang_array $langs($language)
00296           
00297         # Set the case sensitivity
00298         $txt configure -casesensitive $lang_array(casesensitive)
00299         
00300         # Add the language keywords
00301         ctext::addHighlightClass $txt keywords $theme(keywords) "" $lang_array(keywords)
00302         
00303         # Add the language symbols
00304         ctext::addHighlightClass $txt symbols  $theme(keywords) "" $lang_array(symbols)
00305         
00306         # Add the rest of the sections
00307         set_language_section $txt punctuation   $lang_array(punctuation)
00308         set_language_section $txt numbers       $lang_array(numbers)
00309         set_language_section $txt precompile    $lang_array(precompile)
00310         set_language_section $txt miscellaneous $lang_array(miscellaneous)
00311         
00312         # Add the comments and strings
00313         ctext::setBlockCommentPatterns $txt $lang_array(bcomments) $theme(comments)
00314         ctext::setLineCommentPatterns  $txt $lang_array(lcomments) $theme(comments)
00315         ctext::setStringPatterns       $txt $lang_array(strings)   $theme(strings)
00316 
00317         # Add the FIXME
00318         ctext::addHighlightClassForRegexp $txt fixme $theme(miscellaneous) "" {FIXME}
00319         
00320         # Set the indentation namespace for the given text widget to be
00321         # the indent/unindent expressions for this language
00322         [ns indent]::set_indent_expressions $txt.t $lang_array(indent) $lang_array(unindent)
00323         
00324         # Set the completer options for the given language
00325         [ns completer]::set_auto_match_chars $txt.t $lang_array(matchcharsallowed)
00326 
00327       } rc]} {
00328         tk_messageBox -parent . -type ok -default ok -message [msgcat::mc "Syntax error in %s.syntax file" $language] -detail $rc
00329       }
00330       
00331     }
00332     
00333     # Save the language
00334     set lang($txt) $language
00335 
00336     # Re-highlight
00337     $txt highlight 1.0 end
00338     
00339     # Generate a <<ThemeChanged>> event on the text widget
00340     event generate $txt <<ThemeChanged>>
00341     
00342     # Set the menubutton text
00343     if {[info exists [ns gui]::widgets(info_syntax)]} {
00344       [set [ns gui]::widgets(info_syntax)] configure -text $language
00345     }
00346     
00347   }
